questions.question: In business_rules BR002 logic_summary, you state 'on INVALID KEY display "ACCOUNT not found"' but line 246 actually displays 'INVALID ACCOUNT NUMBER FOUND'. Additionally, line 178 in MAIN-PARA displays 'ACCOUNT ' ACCT-ID ' NOT FOUND' if WS-ACCT-READ-STATUS NOT = 0. Does this constitute a factual inaccuracy in the documented message?

What about the other input files opened as INPUT but not read: CUSTOMER-FILE (SELECT at line 34, open at 271), CARD-FILE (line 46, open 307), TRANSACT-FILE (line 58, open 343)? Should they be included in the inputs section even if unused for reads?
In data_flow.reads_from for ACCOUNT-FILE, fields_used is empty (citation 243). What fields, if any, from ACCOUNT-RECORD are used after the read at line 243?

In error_handling for CLOSE operations, you cite lines like 258,263 which are actually OPEN error handling. Moreover, line 372 in 9000-DALYTRAN-CLOSE incorrectly displays 'ERROR CLOSING CUSTOMER FILE' and moves CUSTFILE-STATUS (line 373) instead of DALYTRAN-STATUS. Is this code error documented?

In purpose summary, you note 'No updates or writes to output files are performed despite comment indicating posting of transactions' (line 5). Given open_questions already raise this, are there any conditional paths or copybook logic that might perform writes to TRANSACT-FILE or others?
